Issues.Title: Fix transparent rendering with parents that have a background image
Issues.Body:
If a Graphics backing HDC has an offset origin (SetViewportOrgEx), drawing with a texture brush will reset it. Getting the HDC and releasing it will restore the offset.

Add a few helper methods to HDC to make debugging this sort of thing easier.

Fixes #13784
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13797)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix transparent rendering with parents that have a background image" (#13797)

Issues.Title: Fix title bar small icon scaling
Issues.Body: We weren't actually scaling the icon for the main form. In addition, we didn't have an embedded icon with multiple resolutions. This appropriately sets the right sized icon to eliminate or reduce blurring. At 200% fixed, vs. before: ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13787)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix title bar small icon scaling" (#13787)

Issues.Title: Broken rendering with BackgroundImage and transparent BackColor
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET Core 3.0 - .NET 9.0 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? Yes ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? Works in .NET Framework 2.x - 4.x ### Issue description Set a background image and transparent background for a non-root level container object, such as a `GroupBox` or a `Panel`, and add child controls to it. While the background image offset is applied correctly to the child controls, this is not true for the 'foreground' content of the parent, which is reflected in every child control with an incorrect origin. It apparently affects system rendering only (i.e. when `FlatStyle` is `System`), or when a control has no `FlatStyle` (e.g. a `Panel`). Consider the example below: Designer: Rendering in .NET Framework: Rendering in .NET Core/.NET: (Note the "ghost" group boxes appearing in the panel and other controls. The image itself is rendered correctly in the children even if they are over a more colorful area.) ### Steps to reproduce See the attachment: [BackgroundImageIssue.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21613643/BackgroundImageIssue.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Broken rendering with BackgroundImage and transparent BackColor" (#13784)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[main] Source code updates from dotnet/dotnet" (#13783)

Issues.Title: Dark Mode: RichTextBox with RTF Text is hard to visible
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET SDK 10.0.100-rc.1.25410.103 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? Not tested/verified ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? The issue also can reproduce on .NET 9.0 ### Issue description When using `RichTextBox` to display RTF content in Dark Mode, the text is not easily readable because it blends into the dark background. However, in Classic Mode, the text is displayed correctly. The issue appears to be related to the default text color not being visible on a dark background in Dark Mode. Dark mode: Classic mode: ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create Winforms .NET application with targeting .NET 10 with `RichTextBox `control 2. Assign RTF content to the `RichTextBox `(e.g., "Hello, **World!**" with bold formatting) ``` string rtfText = "{\\rtf1\\ansi\\ansicpg1252\\deff0\\nouicompat\\deflang1033{\\fonttbl{\\f0\\fnil\\fcharset0 Calibri;}}\\viewkind4\\uc1 \\pard\\sa200\\sl276\\slmult1\\f0\\fs22\\lang9 Hello, \\b World\\b0 !\\par}"; richTextBox1.Rtf = rtfText; ``` 3. Set project under Dark mode in program.cs file: ``` #pragma warning disable WFO5001 Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark); #pragma warning restore WFO5001 ``` 4. Build and run project to observe
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dark Mode: RichTextBox with RTF Text is hard to visible" (#13782)

Issues.Title: Dark Mode: The NumeircUpdown/DomainUpdown have incorrect background color when setting the ReadOnly = True
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET SDK 10.0.100-rc.1.25410.103 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? No ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? There have improvement after merged the PR: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13747 ### Issue description The NumericUpDown/DomainUpdown have incorrect background color when setting the ReadOnly = True in DarkMode: **DarkMode:** **Classic Mode:** ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create Winforms .NET application with targeting .NET 10 2. Add NumericUpDown/DomainUpdown controls in form designer, and setting the ReadOnly = True 3. Set app under Dark mode in program.cs file: ``` #pragma warning disable WFO5001 Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark); #pragma warning restore WFO5001 ``` 4. Build and run project
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dark Mode: The NumeircUpdown/DomainUpdown have incorrect background color when setting the ReadOnly = True" (#13781)

Issues.Title: [Dark Mode] The color contrast for selected DataGridViewTextBox is insufficient
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET 10 SDK build: 10.0.100-rc.1.25401.103 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? Not tested/verified ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? Occurs when DarkMode feature involved ### Issue description When the application is in Dark Mode, the color contrast of DataGridViewTextBox is insufficient. This issue does not occur in Classic Mode. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create Winforms .NET application with targeting .NET 10 2. Add a DataGridView control with DataGridViewTextBoxColumn in form designer 3. Set app under Dark mode in program.cs file: ``` #pragma warning disable WFO5001 Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark); #pragma warning restore WFO5001 ``` 4. Build and run project 5. Input something in DataGridViewTextBox, then select this cell 6. Observe the color contrast between selected DataGridViewTextBox's Text color and Back color
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Dark Mode] The color contrast for selected DataGridViewTextBox is insufficient" (#13780)

Issues.Title: Dark Mode: The text still is white for Label control with setting the Enable = False & FlatStyle = System in DarkMode
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET SDK 10.0.100-rc.1.25410.103 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? No ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? The issue also can reproduce on .NET 9.0 ### Issue description The text still is white for Label control with setting the Enable = False & FlatStyle = System in DarkMode ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create Winforms .NET application with targeting .NET 10 2. Add a Label control in form designer, and setting the Enable = False & FlatStyle = System 3. Set app under Dark mode in program.cs file: ``` #pragma warning disable WFO5001 Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark); #pragma warning restore WFO5001 ``` 4. Build and run project **More info:** The issue also can reproduce on Button/CheckBox/RadioButton controls with same configurations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dark Mode: The text still is white for Label control with setting the Enable = False & FlatStyle = System in DarkMode" (#13779)

Issues.Title: [Dark Mode] The color contrast of selected list Item's Back color and Border color is insufficient
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET 10 SDK build: 10.0.100-rc.1.25401.103 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? Not tested/verified ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? Occurs when DarkMode feature involved ### Issue description When the application is in Dark Mode, the color contrast of selected list Item's Back color and Border color is insufficient. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create a WinForms .NET Core application with ListView control 2. Add some items for listview control 3. Enable DarkMode as below in Program.cs file ``` #pragma warning disable WFO5001 Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark); #pragma warning restore WFO5001 ``` 4. Build and run the application 5. Selected the list item, and then using the Accessibility Insight tool to observe the color contrast between selected list Item's Back color and Border color
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Dark Mode] The color contrast of selected list Item's Back color and Border color is insufficient" (#13778)

Issues.Title: Dark Mode: Divider line between Up and Down buttons is not visible in DomainUpDown/NumericUpDown when mouse-over or click them
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET SDK 10.0.100-rc.1.25410.103 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? Not tested/verified ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? Yes, occurs after the PR change: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13747 ### Issue description In dark mode, the divider line between the `UpButton` and `DownButton` in both` DomainUpDown `and `NumericUpDown` controls becomes invisible when the mouse hovers over the buttons or when they are clicked. This results in a lack of visual separation between the buttons, negatively impacting the user interface's clarity and usability. It doesn't repro in classic mode. Just run app: Hover the mouse over the `UpButton` and `DownButton`, or click on them: ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create Winforms .NET application with targeting .NET 10 2. Add `DomainUpDown`/`NumericUpDown` control in form designer 3. Set app under Dark mode in program.cs file: ``` #pragma warning disable WFO5001 Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark); #pragma warning restore WFO5001 ``` 4. Build and run app 5. Hover the mouse over the `UpButton` and `DownButton`, or click on them.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dark Mode: Divider line between Up and Down buttons is not visible in DomainUpDown/NumericUpDown when mouse-over or click them" (#13777)

Issues.Title: Dark Mode: The TrackBar control have the incorrect outline when selected it
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET SDK 10.0.100-rc.1.25410.103 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? No ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? The issue also can reproduce on .NET 9.0 ### Issue description The TrackBar control have the incorrect outline in DarkMode **DarkMode:** The outline of TrackBar is **solid** line **Classic Mode:** The outline of TrackBar is **dot** line ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create Winforms .NET application with targeting .NET 10 2. Add a TrackBar control in form designer 3. Set app under Dark mode in program.cs file: ``` #pragma warning disable WFO5001 Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark); #pragma warning restore WFO5001 ``` 4. Build and run project 5. Tab to TrackBar or selected the TrackBar by using mouse
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dark Mode: The TrackBar control have the incorrect outline when selected it" (#13776)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[main] Source code updates from dotnet/dotnet" (#13772)

Issues.Title: Add focused state for DropDownButton and reduces the icon width of the dropdown model button
Issues.Body: Fixes #13766, #13765 ## Proposed changes - Added a Focused state to the property page's drop-down button. - Reduces the icon width of the model button. ## Customer Impact - The drop-down button of the Property page can be focused under DarkMode ## Regression? - Yes ## Risk - Minimal ## Screenshots ### Before Dropdown arrow and ellipse symbol in PropertyGrid appears larger in DarkMode and the focus indicator (e.g., dotted line or outline) is not visible when navigating to the DropDownButton or Ellipse Button controls by keyboard Dark mode on 100% DPI: Dark mode on 250% DPI: ### After The dropdown arrow appears normal and it can be focued 100% DPI: 250% DPI: ## Test methodology - manually ## Test environment(s) - .net 10.0.0-preview.7.25377.103 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13773)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add focused state for DropDownButton and reduces the icon width of the dropdown model button" (#13773)

Issues.Title: Add judgement "IsDarkModeEnabled" for FocusForeColor of the CheckedListBox and PropertyGrid
Issues.Body: Fixes #13767 ## Proposed changes - Add judgement `IsDarkModeEnabled` for ` FocusForeColor` of the **CheckedListBox** and **PropertyGrid** ## Customer Impact - The selected item of the control **CheckedListBox** and **PropertyGrid** can be show clearly under DarkMode ## Regression? - No ## Risk - Minimal ## Screenshots ### Before When the application is in Dark Mode, the contrast of focusing items in CheckedListBox/PropertyGrid is insufficient. ### After The contrast of focusing items in CheckedListBox/PropertyGrid is sufficient ## Test methodology - Manually ## Test environment(s) - .net 10.0.0-preview.7.25373.104 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13771)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add judgement "IsDarkModeEnabled" for FocusForeColor of the CheckedListBox and PropertyGrid" (#13771)

Issues.Title: Add DesignerAPI Analyzer
Issues.Body: Related #13763 ## Background Some developers may still use .net framework winform api to do designer work. But we have changed it into a new model. They may not aware of if. So they usually couldn't get what they want because they don't use new API. So I think it might be a good idea to add an Analyzer to give it a prompt to recommend the user to use new API. ## Note This is not a refined PR. So please see if it is a good idea. If so, you can give me some advice and I will continue to work on it. If not,I will consider to close it. ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13770)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add DesignerAPI Analyzer" (#13770)

Issues.Title: System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser memory leak issue
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser memory leak issue" (#13769)
